description: This dashboard is designed to be a one-stop solution for monitoring your Kubernetes cluster

panels.description: This dashboard aggregates metrics from all the following k8s clusters
panels.title: Kubernetes Clusters

options.content: API Server
Nodes

panels.description: Indicates whether API Server, Scheduler or Controller manager is down.
panels.title: Control Plane Status

panels.description: This is true if there is insufficient memory on the node, which could cause the node to swap frequently.
panels.title: Memory Pressure

panels.description: This condition is true if there is insufficient disk space on the node.
panels.title: Disk Pressure

panels.description: True when there are too many processes running on the node, indicating a potential exhaustion of process identifiers (PIDs).
panels.title: PID Pressure

panels.description: Indicates that the network to the node is not correctly configured or not available.
panels.title: Network Unavailable

options.content: Pods

panels.description: Last 15Min
panels.title: Failed Pods

panels.description: Indicates that there are pods that were evicted
panels.title: Failed Pods Reason

panels.description: Last 15Min
panels.title: Unscheduled Pods

panels.description: Last 15Min
panels.title: Containers in CPU Throttling

options.content: Persistent Volume Claims

targets.expr: count (max by (persistentvolumeclaim,namespace) (kubelet_volume_stats_used_bytes{} ) and (max by (persistentvolumeclaim,namespace) (kubelet_volume_stats_used_bytes{} )) / (max by (persistentvolumeclaim,namespace) (kubelet_volume_stats_capacity_bytes{} )) >= (80 / 100)) or vector (0)

panels.description: This table shows health status of nodes.
panels.title: Health Status by Node

panels.description: The table shows available disk size by mount points. Only mount point that used over 50% are displayed.

targets.expr: max by (instance, fstype, mountpoint) (node_filesystem_size_bytes{job="node-exporter", fstype!="", mountpoint!=""})

panels.title: Disk by Mount Point

panels.title: CPU Throttling Seconds

panels.description: Pods whose Mem usage/Mem limits is more then 65%.
panels.title: Pods with Potential Mem Leaks
